There are exercises in the course, but unrealistic time frame allocated to complete the exercises.

The accommodation at Wyboston Lakes (North of London) is wholly unacceptable. The accommodation area is akin to a hostel. Small, very small rooms with beds that are so uncomfortable that several people on my course, me included, are waking up in pain every night. The food, whilst plentiful can be cold.

The instructor was very knowledgeable and helpful within the time constraints of the course.

Overall a bad experience and poor training. Its ok if you just want to pass the course and not learn.

headline: Tough but worth it
reviewBody: Accelerated learning is not for all but it did the job for me, thanks to @perbeining and firebrand

headline: Excellent all round
reviewBody:
I can't recommend this training provider enough, everything is designed to make you feel comfortable and have a good environment to learn in. The instructor was very knowledgeable and made the course interesting and enjoyable. 
The training facilities were excellent.
The accomodation was basic but did the job and the selection and quality of the food was very good too. 
I will be back in the future.

headline: Not for the faint-hearted
reviewBody: In the space of six days, you are supposed to learn the contents of an entire textbook. However, this is not something you are likely to forget very quickly. Although the learning experience is intense, it is also enriching and this comes with great support from the instructors at Firebrand. To get the result from the exam you sit - in relation to the course you are taking - is a huge relief because it requires hard work and commitment to what you are doing. They teach you beyond what you need to know, still engaging everyone during the lessons.

headline: ITIL Bootcamp
reviewBody:
Perfect way to learn all in a few days! Sam our trainer brought so many "real life" stories into our sessions which made it easier to take things in and keep them in! 
The intensive learning is a huge benefit to any employer - time away from the office is minimal and your return with a cert 😃

headline: VCP5DCV - Great trainer, awful lab equipment
reviewBody: VCP5DCV - 8-12 Dec. The trainer made this course. He made a very tough week bearable. The labs were a complete let down. The equipment was so slow that a lot of the people in the class just stopped doing them. For the price you pay for the course it's unacceptable for the practical side of the course to be so poor. If the money had come from my pocket I'd be demanding compensation. Other than that the hotel/training centre and food were brilliant.

headline: Awesome staff. Excellent centre.
reviewBody: The staff here are faultless.  They really know their stuff. There were some issues (not with Firebrand though) with pre - reading.  The lack of this did have an impact on my outcome so maybe that would need addressing. The days were incredibly long but Firebrand do everything they can to make it a comfortable stay. This will be my third experience here and every time it's the same. Consistency is good. Staff are lovely.  They are on hand to answer any questions and are sympathetic to issues raised.

headline: Thorough, friendly, good amenities and focused
reviewBody: The Firebrand site accommodation was ideally located next to the training rooms, the food was always excellent and staff friendly. The tailored Firebrand training rooms were well equipped and a bonus was the free vend coffee machines which actually tasted very good! One of the best features of the training rooms is that they are accessible 24hours a day which on these courses is a good environment to study to keep focused. The staff and trainers were all very Knowledgeable and helpful. I have already added another Firebrand course to my training plan for March 2015 so that is a good indication how happy I was with the overall experience

headline: Training at its best
reviewBody:
Having attended many technical (and some not so technical ones) over the last 16 years, I wholeheartedly can say that I haven't enjoyed a course as much as my firebrand CISSP training.

My future plans for training will include FB going forward. Others don't compare.

Thanks!

headline: Lack of prerequsit info.
reviewBody:
They failed on a number of points. 
First when not having English as native U could apply for 25% extra exam time. NOT imformed. If U felt that U not were fully prepared for the exam U postpone it and have the exam later Not imformed. Errors in the documentation does NOT make it easier. No Firebrand SHAPE UP.
BUT Richard knigth was a fantastic teacher.

headline: Firebrand offer fantastic trainers, and an unmatched learning environment
reviewBody: If you need to get a qualification in a short period of time, i would recommend Firebrand each and every time. Be prepared however for long intense training days and be sure to do some preparation before the actual course. This type of training isn't for everyone but if your willing to put in the effort it will pay off.

headline: Great training with great staff!
reviewBody:
I was very happy with my training during my week at Firebrand, I learnt alot and had a great experience while there, the staff were excellent and Gary Fildes is an amazing trainer who pulled out all the stops to make sure we all passed the exams at the end of the week.

The accommodation was reasonable, nothing especially good but you don't tend to spend long in your room. There is free Wifi in the hotel and in the Firebrand training centre, but the Wifi is accessible by anyone (Firebrand Wifi is password protected but they hand it out to everyone who is training there, and the hotel is an unlocked network) so I wouldn't be doing any online banking with the hacking courses they teach.

There are only a few minor drawbacks to the accommodation, firstly there is no phone signal at all (I'm with EE), secondly you don't get any drinks with your meals apart from water, free decent drinks are included in the Firebrand center so don't forget to take one to dinner with you, and lastly the unlimited snacks throughout the day only comprise of some mint imperials in a jar on their reception desk, another type of sweets (fruit pastel/wine gums I believe), or apples or bananas, there is a paid for vending machine though.

As far as the training is concerned, Firebrand is excellent, great for teaching you alot of information and getting you alot of certifications in a very short time. I imagine Firebrand are spending more on the training and trying to save on drinks at dinner and snacks throughout the day, which is fair enough I suppose but they would have been nice to have!

headline: The firebrand CISSP boot camp is the best way to prepare yourself for the toughest exam out there.
reviewBody: The boot camp was an essential part of my preparation for the CISSP exam. I am not a technical person and they tailored the material for all levels of experience in the room. I found the days long but rewarding and would defiantly recommend this trainer to anyone unreservedly.

headline: Excellent Training Enviornment
reviewBody: This was a very good course, with the material being at a good pace. The facilities are also top quality and the residential course is great as it takes you away from your business/work environment.

headline: Turbo learning
reviewBody: Bright teachers with solid practice know how, intense 12-16 hours days, useful labs, immediate exams... just great !

headline: you get out of this what you put in, participation is the key to success
reviewBody: Long days and mentally draining with homework on top of the tutored study, but worth it to get the subject matter clear in your head before tackling the exam. Everything is provided on site so there is not need to concern yourself with anything other than learning. LA

headline: Firebrand Training does what it says on the tin.
reviewBody:
I returned to Firebrand as they have a reputation to keep and I trust it. 
Training is not always easy, but its nice to know you can go back and get retrained should you have to. Taking difficult exams is hard enough without the stress if you don't succeed the first time round.
The staff are friendly and very helpful, and the free flowing coffee helps, but not sure if I'd want to spend all my time in the training rooms which are available 24/7, but nice to know they are if you need to use the facilities.
Their trainers are second to none, They are leaders in their field of expertise, which is why they are so good, PS. Many thanks Kevin.
Would I use them again? Oh most definitely, they are the best.

headline: What you don't know you don't know!
reviewBody: I now know what to look out for in questions and what to look out for.

headline: Excellent facilities. Expert Instructors. Well customized materials.
reviewBody: Excellent facilities. Expert Instructors. Well customized materials.

headline: Another quality training course
reviewBody:
I found the course enjoyable and the delivery professional.  In particular, the knowledge of the subject matter was impeccable, judgement of where to focus the training was relevant and control of the classroom and discussions were well balanced.

It's hard work and commitment is expected but total immersion with quality training in a comfortable and focussed environment works for me. 
 
When you're spending your own money on training it's a good feeling to walk away feeling like it's money well spent.

headline: Compressed course leading to high failure rate (Software Testing Foundation)
reviewBody:
I couldn't honestly recommend this course because there is far too much material to squeeze into 2 days.  The result was that students who seemed more than capable of  passing, failed the exam due to the lack of time.  This is an expensive course and I feel these students were badly let down by Firebrand.

Course materials, facilities, staff and instruction were all excellent.  

Although I was one of the 2 students who passed, I'm sure the course would have been more beneficial and enjoyable, spread over 3 days.

headline: Brilliant!
reviewBody: Great customer, from moment of arrival, Gary was brilliant from the very first minute, was willing to stay behind or get in early if extra support was needed. The training included very long hours but did not drag with the way it was taught. Gary is a credit to Firebrand, thank-you Gary!!

headline: CISSP Boot Camp Highly Recommended...!!
reviewBody: My experience at Firebrand was excellent. They had provide a very wholesome and exciting experience to training and it helped me a lot to concentrate on my course.

headline: Exactly what I needed for a springboard into IT/Cyber Security
reviewBody:
I have done two courses now with firebrand and have been very impressed with both. The environment to learn in was spot on, location, hardware and software provided. There was so much information in the CEH and ECSA/LPT courses yet my instructor "Dimittrios Zacharopoulos" knew exactly what was important to know for exam purposes and also for real world use.
Would be more than happy to recommend Firebrand and definitely attend again myself. They are my trainer of choice, if i could afford to fund the courses myself.

headline: Great experience
reviewBody: This was a great experience, Thank to Firebrand for providing such a class.

headline: Excellent Training, Facilities and Customer Service
reviewBody: I have attended a couple of courses with Firebrand and have been very happy with the entire experience each time. The courses were well delivered by a very knowledgeable and personable trainers. The facilities and accommodation were excellent. The customer service was first class. All in all a great training provider.

headline: CISSP training at firebrandtraining
reviewBody:
Poor experience.
Hotel didnt provide internet in the peak hours.
Quality of the trainer was very poor. You dont get anything extra apart from reading the ISC book page by page and some out-of-date testing from 2009. 
90% of attenders in my course thought exactly the same than me.

headline: Excellent training method
reviewBody: Good way of learning, good for speed up learning process with competent teachers.

headline: Great on site AX Development training
reviewBody: Being at a facility which allows us to focus on training alone without disruptions, as well as 24hr access to the classroom makes a big difference.  I believe I've learnt a lot more this way.

headline: Firebrand Training is the way to go
reviewBody: Learning a skill at double speed is a rare opportunity, but Firebrand Training is making this possible. This is perfect for those who have limited time available to be away from work , or for those who have a family at home, and don't want to spend a whole week away. You get the same amount of hours education, but using fewer days. Yes it's intensive, but with highly skilled trainers makes this both fun and manageable. Thumbs up!

headline: Firebrandtraining - worth to go !
reviewBody:
Very good trainer with expert knowledge in the training subject.
Good food and service.

Very good class room to learn and repeat at anytime.

Highly recommended !

headline: Excellent CEH course at Firebrand
reviewBody:
Good course and facilities. Excellent instructor,
Covered lots of ground in a short period.

headline: Extremely well delivered course
reviewBody: I cannot emphasise enough how well this course was delivered. The instructor used various techniques to keep everyone engaged and interested. Pre-reading is a must, if only to understand some terminology. The mixture of working in groups, exam practice and instructor lead discussion was a great combination.

headline: Not interested when things go wrong
reviewBody:
I sent one of my team on an A+ course; while he learn a lot, the feedback that he game me indicated that the course material did not match that required in the exam. I also understand that the tutor was new to the subject.  All of this could have been resolved but despite trying to contract Firebrand asking for some feedback no one has bothered to contact me which for me has ruined an otherwise good experience.

10 March 2014: An update: I have to say that Firebrand have done their utmost to rectify this (and I've upgraded from two stars to four).   While I can and do recommend Firebrand I still think that some initial feedback would have prevented me from posting this in the first place.

headline: Tough but thoroughly rewarding
reviewBody: This is a tough but thoroughly rewarding way to learn. Intense training, a good trainer and excellent standard food & accommodation... I really would recommend this to anyone who needs new skills and fast!

headline: Amazing Training Company!
reviewBody: I recently started the firebrand training program and was amazed at the facilities, the food and the level of service they provide, I would definitely recommend them to anyone who would like to take a training course.

headline: An extremely well organised intensive training environment, which helps realise individual potential within the IT sector.
reviewBody:
Having experienced the Firebrand Training methods on several occasions I can highly recommend this Bootcamp style of training to those who wish to consolidate their prior knowledge, with the ultimate goal being a well deserved IT qualification. Firebrand is specifically suited to those who have the dedication to put concentrated effort into processing the vast information imparted by the highly experienced and carefully selected Firebrand instructors.

Thanks to the assistance of Firebrand Training, I have successfully gained the CompTIA A+, N+ and Security+ qualifications, passing all on the first attempt. This training really works and is therefore highly recommended.

headline: Intense but well worth the effort - top notch training!!!
reviewBody:
I studied the CCNA at the Firebrand campus approx 2.5 years ago. I would thoroughly recommend Firebrand to anyone. It's not for the faint hearted as it is long days and very intense training but it really is worth every bit of effort. You not only get certified but the term paper CCNA need not apply to anyone who have attended the course with Firebrand. It really does prepare you for not only the exam but also for the real world. 

Best training I have ever attended - A+

I would just like to finish with a big well done Firebrand!

headline: The best training company in the UK
reviewBody:
Great accelerated learning which helped me earn my Comptia A+ 

Great accommodation, food , the tutor was great, onsite testing. Can't ask for much more.

headline: As usual with Firebrand, you expect and get the best in IT training
reviewBody: As usual with Firebrand, short week, long hours, but well worth the effort. Quality instructors, good hotel, and good result at the end.

headline: The best place to learn quickly - by far!
reviewBody:
Having blogged my last experience, I am a very big fan of Firebrand for training you quickly, efficiently and thoroughly.  I have even sent my wife their for PRINCE2.  I have been 5 times and every time enjoyed it, learned a shed load of content and met a lot of great people.

Keep up the great work!!!

headline: The training gets done fast so you can get on with your life!
reviewBody: The firebrand trainers are experts in their field. They have to be so they can blast through the training material at express speeds. Their real world experience gives pointers that allow you to make critical decisions in your own environment that make a real difference to your delivery and your career. Remember back to University or college where so much of your time was spent just hand copying notes from a board, or travelling back and forward.  Or how the tutor just copied stuff on to the board from the standard text book for you to write down.  Take all that away, and your training gets done super fast, and the time between the start of the course and the end isn't long enough that you could have forgotten it already!

headline: Seriously efficient training in lovely surroundings
reviewBody:
My PRINCE2 qualification was a great experience. 

The trainer was extremely knowledgeable with good real life experience and the classrooms, accommodation and catering were all of a very high standard. 

I look forward to my next opportunity to visit Firebrand for another qualification!

headline: The only way to learn - top quality instructors running at top speed
reviewBody:
Forget online studying. It takes way too long and you cannot ask an instructor for help. It's just a waste of money. 

The best way to learn is in the classroom setting with a qualified and experienced Instructor. That's why I went with Firebrand. You have an intensive yet very enjoyable week with highly qualified and experienced instructors and the results speak for themselves. I passed both my Certification exams first time with very high marks. 

I couldn't imagine studying any other way. Firebrand is the best and I'm definitely coming back for more.

You should too if you are serious about getting qualified.

headline: Quality Training
reviewBody: It's long hours and hard work, but if you are prepared to put the effort in, the rewards are there for the taking.

headline: Third time unlucky
reviewBody:
I had previously rated Firebrand training, having completed two courses successfully with no issues. However, booking for a third time was not a great experience. The course was cancelled, but I only found out when I called to find out where the training material was. I am now waiting for then to reimburse my company for the full fees that needed to be paid over one month in advance.

As a contractor taking time off to train is an additional cost on top of the training itself. Firebrand's condensed approach means you can achieve the same results in about two thirds the time. However, cancelling courses at the last minute means that not only do you not achieve the qualifications you had expected, but you also loose out on lost earnings for the time you have booked off.

headline: Got me what I needed in little under 2 weeks!
reviewBody:
I was one of the first to train with firebrand on the MCITP EA course. At the time 13 days, 5 exams, including 1 practical. It's really hard work, but with exceptional teaching and the best environment for me to learn i as blasting out over 80% on all my tests.

I now sit as the Network Manager for an independent school, when I can i will be going back to firebrand for as much training as i can afford. Certifications are the future!!!

headline: Firebrand got me the job i wanted
reviewBody:
2 x 7 day courses at Firebrand gave me the skills to apply, get and be very successful in a new job. I am now managing a group of developers in a really enjoyable job.

Many thanks for the great kick start to my career

Thx

headline: The fast track to success
reviewBody: Firebrand training is the sort of company that pushes you to your full potential. Ok, so the courses are intensive, but you learn so much in the short time that your at the training facility that you wonder why it took so long to learn before. The rooms are well prepared and the food is top not h, although the meal times are controlled because of the numbers of students on site. Would I recommend firebrand or go back again? To right I would

headline: Experienced, knowledgeable trainers who assist you to get through at a fast pace
reviewBody: I attended an accelerated (3 day) PRINCE2 course with Firebrand last year. Very happy with the quality of the trainer and his practical experience. Good notes. He kept the pace going, handled the class, and had a good success rate. Would use again.

headline: Best in the market of residential courses
reviewBody: Most of the courses offered by Firebrand are designed to accommodate the accelerated learning pattern which works great and still they are not rushed but well planned and balanced. You not only pass the certification offered through many courses but also learn a lot and due to residential nature of the course you have a great time too. From the communication to food provided to the free coffees/biscuits and Xbox (yes xbox) to the trainer, the course material and extensive focus on getting you pass the exam I believe Firebrand is the market leader. 100% recommended !!!

headline: Get certified, Get Firebrand
reviewBody:
If you want  to get on in IT, if you want to get certified and actually learn what you need to do your NEW job, then get Firebranded. 
Top rated instructors with real world experience, Failure is NOT an option

headline: Top-end Trusted Trainers - would be 5 stars if cheaper accommodation or is not mandatory.
reviewBody:
As I pay for myself, going back to Firebrand Training for my MSP Programme Management training following my PRINCE2 Project Management training knowing there are cheaper alternatives available especially as I am a very experienced Programme and Project Manager already, is the best statement of how I rate the value Firebrand Training have delivered to me.
The accommodation and catering is pretty decent (hope it has been maintained!), providing a quiet venue for the critical after-hours study away from family / household distractions.
The Instructors I have had were absolutely top-quality, able to maintain that difficult balance with delegates who have no experience to war-horses with years of bad habits. :-)

headline: Fantastic, fast paced training
reviewBody:
I completed my Prince2 course earlier this year and was pleased with the result.... I passed!

Not only did I pass, but I learnt something. Which I have brought back to the office to implement amongst teams.

Firebrand doesnt just teach you to pass, it allows you to learn what you are studying, and apply it to real life.

headline: The training puts the candidate in a great position to pass the exam if that person is a willing participant.
reviewBody: FireBrand isolates the factors that enable student understanding and which secure exam success.  A person attending the course is very likely to attain the necessary grade if they are willing to immerse themselves in the experience and adopt well-informed advice.

headline: Accelerated learning, with a difference.
reviewBody:
Loved my time at Firebrand. I've been twice and each time i've been with a group of individuals that possess an individual skillset. All teaching was approached to benefit even those with little to no experience of using the technology. 
Trainers were fantastic and could be considered friends as well as mentors. Food was superb, as was accommodation. Will be booking my third course at the end of June and will be taking a few friends (outside of work) who will benefit from the same study.

headline: Long and hard. So was the course.
reviewBody: I've been to Firebrand a lot over the years. The courses are great with instructors who know what they are about. Prepare for long hard days with little sleep! You'll feel like they forced the entire content of the course books in to your skull and weeks or years later you'll still be remembering everything

headline: CEH Bootcamp put the boot in and delivered results!
reviewBody: I attended the CEH bootcamp earlier this year.  As expected, it was a very intense course, covering a lot of content in a short space of time.  Even though it had been some time since I was "hands-on" in terms of IT, I found it informative and very useful.  There was a really effective mix of classroom learning and practical exercises, with the result that we were able to put the theory into practice immediately and see how it all fit together.  The course met all my expectations, and I would happily use Firebrand in future.

headline: 1st class instructors with real world experience
reviewBody:
The CISSP course was intense with long days, but well worth it, 8:30am - midnight/1am with self study included.  I passed :-)
It is essential that the instructor has real world experience of the topics they are reviewing, and this certainly is the case with Firebrand instructors, our instructor was flown over from New York and was extremely knowledgeable.
I have no hesitation in recommending Firebrand and would definitely undertake another Firebrand course.

headline: Experience dedicated teachings
reviewBody: I have experienced this dedicated and real intensive concept twice and have both times been swept away by the sensation. The staff is to point and know how to keep you on your toes and focused.

headline: Firebrand Is Great
reviewBody: I would definitely recommend firebrand to everyone, the training is so good, and the instructors are friendly and very helpfull

headline: Perfect organized, high level of education
reviewBody:
I had a pleasure to participate in a SCCM 2007 training. Everything was organized perfect. The tranport from the airport, lodgging and the most iportant technical stuff. The trainer was available 24/7 it was really great.
I trully recommend Firebrand as an Education Center .

headline: There is no quicker way to learn.
reviewBody:
You want to have that prestigious and recognized technical certification but don't know how to go about it,  Do you use online training, purchase the books, find time to do it yourself. 

 The simple truth of the matter is that Firebrand offer the best environment and format to prepare yourself for that challenging certification in the shortest amount of time.  Find the time in your schedule to complete you training course with Firebrand and immerse yourself in that topic for those required days with no distraction.  

The accommodation, meals, training materials, learning environment and most importantly the certified trainers, with real world experience are all there for you to tap into in the time that you need them for.    All you need to bring is yourself.

headline: Fantastic way of learning
reviewBody: I was a bit apprehensive in this way of learning.  I had to do 3 exams in 8 days, and I passed.  The course was really relevant to what I do and the way the material is taught is brilliant.  I am going to be looking at coming back in 2014 to go down this route again.  The food was also good and this is really important as I could not believe how hungry I was from all that learning!! Thank for Firebrand!!!!

headline: Princely Prince2
reviewBody: Having sat in a number of project meetings and not understood the jargon or the processes used I decided it was time to bone up on Prince2. The course offered by Firebrand was all inclusive and at a good price. The clincher was the availability of weekend training which allowed me to sell the idea of my attendance based on the fact that more of my time was invested in it than work's time so my responsibilities would be covered. No one at Firebrand pretended that the course wouldn't be hard work and I was made aware of this before booking. I entered into the course with my eyes open but very well prepared with the materials that were sent out in advance. I felt confident trusting the pre-course materials to get me started. Nothing but happy with the course and the result!

headline: I'm like a Microsoft Sponge
reviewBody:
I took both the Windows server 2012 and new Sharepoint 2013 courses over two weeks. Both courses where awesome and jam packed with the course ware but re-enforced with real world example, some great mental aids and quirky tutors which backed up the subject with humorous ways of memorizing the content.

These courses are both fantastic towards gaining an in depth view of the subject and also in taking the exams.

I met some fantastic individuals in an environment where I could both study, network and bounce off as well as two first class tutors who could demonstrate real world application to the subjects.

headline: Clever, complete, concentrated and customised  training!
reviewBody: Firebrand courses are excellent, you're fully immersed in hands on training using real works examples from people who've done the work professionally and not just learnt from a book.

headline: Firebrand delivers experience, fast
reviewBody:
Firebrand training provide an amazing range of courses, as an apprentice learning is a very important part of my Job, Firebrand provide all my training needs, fast and with an amazing amount of support, all the trainers are helpful and if you have a question, or need a little extra help, Firebrand and their instructors stretch the extra mile to keep you comfortable, and to insure that you'll step out the door with everything you need.

I highly recommend Firebrand to anyone who is looking for a IT training provider, they're fast and reliable, giving everything you need to get the skills employers want.

headline: Being able to learn everything, fast.
reviewBody: I went for a weeks training with Firebrand on the apprenticeship level. I was a bit nervous at first with the amount of theory knowledge I knew we were going to have to learn within just a week! But after the first day I felt really confident with the course, and especially with the instructors. I'm now due to be attending my second week of training and I am thoroughly looking forward to it!

headline: How Learning Should Be Done.
reviewBody: Firebrand training is literally the best way to learn, you can learn a course that would take a year or even more in just a few days. I didn't think it was possible, but it really works. if you ever want any IT training then use Firebrand.

headline: If you want to pass, go to Firebrand!
reviewBody:
Spent 8 days doing MCSA 2012 and would recommend to anyone. 

It's a tough 8 days, don't expect to do anything other than eat sleep and breathe studying.

headline: Great training and instructor, to less time.
reviewBody: I had a great week to learn at Firebrand and the instructor knew everything about the subject. Everything I asked could be answered and it's a real bootcamp as how it should be. Only negative point is that the time that I had for the curriculum was too less. If I had two more days I could have learned much more about the subject.

headline: Worth the hard work and sleepless nights !
reviewBody: Really interesting and fully loaded training course, with loads of information and massive amounts of support !

headline: Fun, exciting, fantastic challenge with brilliant trainers!
reviewBody: I thoroughly enjoyed my time with firebrand. My trainer was fantastic and very supportive. I would thoroughly recommend them for all training. They are efficient, reliable and fantastic trainers. Would highly recommend using Firebrand.

headline: Most comprehensive training package i have ever used
reviewBody:
I was a little worried about not having enough time to get through all the course material when i went on the Exchange Server 2010 6 day course - there is a lot of material but when you get into learning mode and have the addition of the amazing instructors you manage just fine (Well i did anyway)
Excellent Staff and Accomodation. A+
